abstract: After lowering its quarterly profit guidance last week, G.E.’s numbers were not surprising. Profit from continuing operations fell 12 percent to $4.5 billion in the third quarter.
snippet: After lowering its quarterly profit guidance last week, G.E.’s numbers were not surprising. Profit from continuing operations fell 12 percent to $4.5 billion in the third quarter.
lead_paragraph: The General Electric Company, in reporting its third-quarter results on Friday, portrayed itself as positioned as conservatively as possible to withstand the turmoil in the financial markets.

headline.main: Finance Arm Weighs on G.E. Results
headline.print_headline: G.E. Projects a Calm Air To Reassure Investors
